intro: Dyschoriste valeriana, commonly known as Valerian weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Dyschoriste valeriana is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is native to regions in Africa and Asia. Its botanical features make it a common weed in various agricultural and natural environments.
